main event: A meteor sighting was reported on September 7, 1958, in Derwood, Maryland, observed by several individuals including soldiers and weather personnel.
interesting points: The meteor was described as part of a larger sighting involving two objects,It's believed the meteor's light was visible from as far away as Indiana and Pennsylvania,Officers from the control tower described the object as having a yellow color,The sighting involved observations from both air-visual and ground-radar perspectives,Witnesses reported fluctuations in the light's intensity during the observations.
witness description: Military personnel and local observers, including soldiers and a weather observer.
